meaning: An official document normally used for international journeys, which proves the identity and nationality of the person for whom it was issued.
example: You will have to bring your passport to prove who you are.

meaning: A word used to gain admittance or to gain access to information; watchword.
Dough made from wheat and water and sometimes mixed with egg and formed into various shapes; often sold in dried form and typically boiled for eating.
A baked food item made from flour and fat pastes such as pie crust; also tarts, bear claws, napoleons, puff pastries, etc.
example: That pastry shop sells not just pastries, but all kinds of baked goods.

meaning: A declaration issued by a government agency declaring someone the inventor of a new invention and having the privilege of stopping others from making, using or selling the claimed invention; a letter patent.
The quality of being patient.
One who protects or supports; a defender or advocate.
example: This car park is for patrons only.

meaning: (in the plural) Debts owed by a business; liabilities.
example: Is value-added tax payable on planning application fees?

meaning: Money received on payday as payment for work performed.
example: He was delighted after getting his first paycheck, but subsequently blew it all on the horses

meaning: A list of employees who receive salary or wages, together with the amounts due to each.
A walker; one who walks or goes on foot, especially as opposed to one who uses a vehicle.
example: pedestrian crossing

meaning: To subject to a penalty, especially for the infringement of a rule or regulation.
A plant of the family Piperaceae.
example: Some ballparks have signs saying "No pepper games".

meaning: One who performs for, or entertains, an audience.
example: the performer of an action

meaning: A publication issued regularly, but less frequently than daily.
In a regular periodic manner
In a permanent manner; lastingly.
To adapt something to the needs or tastes of an individual
An animal kept as a companion.
example: His daughter was petted and spoiled.

meaning: A formal, written request made to an official person or organized body, often containing many signatures.
example: The villagers petitioned the council to demolish the dangerous building.

meaning: A pharmaceutical or pharmacological preparation or product; a drug.
A professional who dispenses prescription drugs in a hospital or retail pharmacy.
(countable) A place where prescription drugs are dispensed; a dispensary.
A machine which reproduces documents by photographing the original over a glass plate and printing duplicates.
A copy made using a photocopier.
One who takes photographs, typically as an occupation.
The art and technology of producing images on photosensitive surfaces, and its digital counterpart.
A practitioner of physic, i.e. a specialist in internal medicine, especially as opposed to a surgeon; a practitioner who treats with medication rather than with surgery.
A medicine or drug, especially a cathartic or purgative.
example: Newtonian physics was extended by Einstein to explain the effects of travelling near the speed of light; quantum physics extends it to account for the behaviour of atoms.

meaning: An informal social gathering, usually in a natural outdoor setting, to which the participants bring their own food and drink.
example: We went out for a picnic in the forest.

meaning: A type of pastry that consists of an outer crust and a filling.
example: The family had steak and kidney pie for dinner and cherry pie for dessert.

meaning: A small, usually round or cylindrical object designed for easy swallowing, usually containing some sort of medication.
example: Jane went on the pill when she left for college.

meaning: A soft cushion used to support the head in bed.
A baked Italian dish of a thinly rolled bread dough crust typically topped before baking with tomato sauce, cheese and other ingredients such as meat, vegetables or fruit
example: Want to go out for pizza tonight?

meaning: The act of placing or putting in place; the act of locating or positioning; the state of being placed.
example: It seems to me that the placement of that poster could be better.

meaning: One who plans.
example: Johnny is a good planner. He starts his work in time to get it finished by the deadline.

meaning: Seemingly or apparently valid, likely, or acceptable; conceivably true or likely
example: a plausible excuse

meaning: The notional area of land able to be farmed in a year by a team of 8 oxen pulling a carruca plow, usually reckoned at 120 acres.
example: The horse-drawn plough had a tremendous impact on agriculture.

meaning: A pronged connecting device which fits into a mating socket, especially an electrical one.
example: I pushed the plug back into the electrical socket and the lamp began to glow again.

meaning: One who works in or with lead.
